content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Automation Science Pack Production Line (around x=8.5, y=13.5)
Consists of following entities:
- Assembling machine-1 at position(8.5, 13.5)
- Iron gear inserter at position(8.5, 10.5)
- Iron gear chest at position(7.5, 10.5)
- Output inserter at position(10.5, 13.5)
- Output chest at position(11.5, 13.5)
- Transport belt system from position(8.5, 11.5) to (6.5, 11.5)

### Power Generation System (around x=-4.5, y=12.5)
Consists of:
- Steam engine at position(-4.5, 12.5)
- Boiler at position(-4.5, 16.0)
- Offshore pump at position(-3.5, 27.5)
- Electric pole network connecting positions (1.5,6.5), (2.5,8.5), (-0.5,8.5), (-1.5,12.5), (0.5,14.5), (8.5,15.5)
- Pipe network connecting water and steam systems

### Mining and Smelting Operations
Multiple mining and smelting setups at various locations:
1. Setup at x=41, y=-82:
   - Burner mining drill
   - Chest at (41.5, -80.5)
   - Burner inserter at (41.5, -79.5)

2. Setup at x=-28, y=-61:
   - Burner mining drill
   - Chest at (-27.5, -59.5)
   - Burner inserter at (-26.5, -59.5)
   - Stone furnace at (-25.0, -59.0)
   - Output inserter at (-23.5, -58.5)
   - Output chest at (-22.5, -58.5)

3. Setup at x=-18, y=-53:
   - Burner mining drill
   - Chest at (-17.5, -51.5)
   - Burner inserter at (-16.5, -51.5)
   - Stone furnace at (-15.0, -51.0)
   - Output inserter at (-13.5, -50.5)
   - Output chest at (-12.5, -50.5)

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement Collision Errors
- Check for existing entities before placing new ones - multiple attempts to place chests and inserters where transport belts, electric poles, or other entities already exist
- When placing entities next to each other, ensure proper spacing and direction to avoid collisions
- Consider the full dimensions of larger entities (like assembling machines and furnaces) when placing adjacent entities

### Resource Management Errors
- Ensure required items are in inventory before attempting to insert them into containers
- Keep burner entities fueled to maintain operation - multiple mining drills are out of fuel

### Production Line Setup
- Plan the layout of production lines carefully to ensure all components (inserters, chests, belts) can be placed without conflicts
- Consider the space needed for input/output logistics when designing production setups

### Power System Management
- Monitor and maintain fuel levels in boilers to ensure consistent power generation
- Ensure proper connection of power poles to maintain electricity network coverage
